    • Method Detail

      • parse

        Product parse(java.math.BigInteger prdID,
              java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String type,
              float price,
              java.lang.String color,
              boolean inCatalog,
              java.lang.String imageURL,
              byte[] byteArr)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        A function that gets all data as parameters, and creates a Product instance with all associated data.
        Parameters:
        prdID - - Product ID
        name - - Product name
        type - - Product type(4 types)
        price - - Product price
        color - - Product color
        inCatalog - - if the product is a catalog item
        imageURL - - Product image URL
        byteArr - - Product image parse into bytes
        Returns:
        new Product instance with all the required data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Can be thrown when updating if update fails

      • handleGet

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> handleGet(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> obj)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception

        A function that get objects from the DB and calls parse. after parse it pushes the data back as a report

        Parameters:
        obj - - an array list of objects the represent row in product table in DB.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Objects with all the information that related to the asking report
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This function uses parse that can throw an exception

      • add

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> add(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> arr)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception

        A function that inserts a row into a product table in DB

        Parameters:
        arr - - ArrayList of Object that represents the data that we want to insert as row in DB
        Returns:
        myMsgArr-An ArrayList of Objects that represnets the answer from DB
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the Exception can be throwed in 2 situations, if there is a problem with the query that sent to the DB. or if the returned values is not from the type we expected.
